subject: Languages
title: Secret Languages and Codes
description: A micro-lesson that makes Secret Languages and Codes usable.

hook.text: Not all invented languages are for sharing. Some are built specifically to keep outsiders out.

buildup.text: Thieves' cants, prison slang, and children's play languages all serve as in-group codes.

discovery.text: Pig Latin and Cockney rhyming slang started as ways to speak openly without being understood.

twist.text: During World War II, Navajo Code Talkers used their natural language as an unbreakable code.

climax.text: The line between a language and a code depends on whether it carries culture or just information.

punchline.text: Some languages are built to connect. Others are built to exclude.

quiz.question: Why were Navajo Code Talkers effective in World War II?
options: Their natural language was unknown to the enemy
